summary: "Master of Puppets," released in 1986, is Metallica's third album and their last with bassist Cliff Burton, who tragically died later that year. Recorded in Denmark, the album features powerful songs and political lyrics, earning widespread praise and considered one of the best metal albums ever. The cover art shows a field of crosses controlled by unseen hands in a red sky. The album was a huge success, reaching number 29 on the Billboard 200 and getting certified six times platinum in the US. It's even in the National Recording Registry for its cultural importance.
title: Master of Puppets
